summary:
An Australian news agency is reporting that robot vacuum cleaners from the Chinese company Deebot are surreptitiously taking photos and recording audio, and sending that data back to the vendor to train their AIs. 
Ecovacs‚Äôs privacy policy‚Äîavailable elsewhere in the app‚Äîallows for blanket collection of user data for research purposes, including:

The 2D or 3D map of the user‚Äôs house generated by the device
Voice recordings from the device‚Äôs microphone
Photos or videos recorded by the device‚Äôs camera
It also states that voice recordings, videos and photos that are deleted via the app may continue to be held and used by Ecovacs
title: Deebot Robot Vacuums Are Using Photos and Audio to Train Their AI

summary:
This seems to be the attitude of many of my fellow nerds‚Äîdesigners and developers‚Äîwhen presented with tools based on large language models that produce dubious outputs based on the unethical harvesting of other people‚Äôs work and requiring staggering amounts of energy to run:


  This is the future.  I need to start using these tools now, even if they‚Äôre flawed, because otherwise I‚Äôll be left behind.  They‚Äôll only get better...
title: Mismatch

summary:
My brain has always done a thing in which it attaches certain memories to other things, such as songs.  Most of the time, the songs have nothing to do with the memory they‚Äôre attached to, other than that I heard that song on that day‚Ä¶and my brain connected the two. 
It‚Äôs a strange thing...
title: üçÇ Autumn Memories

summary: The parents of a 19-year-old Connecticut honors student accused of taking part in a $243 million cryptocurrency heist in August were carjacked a week later, while out house-hunting in a brand new Lamborghini.  Prosecutors say the couple was beaten and briefly kidnapped by six young men who traveled from Florida as part of a botched plan to hold the parents for ransom
title: Lamborghini Carjackers Lured by $243M Cyberheist
